greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: A054525 * A115361.
comment: A129353 = the inverse Möbius transform of A115361.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1275
formula: T(n,k) = A087003(n/k) for k | n, T(n,k) = 0 otherwise. - _Andrew Howroyd_, Aug 03 2018
example: First few rows of the triangle are:
program: (PARI) tabl(nn) = {Tm = matrix(nn, nn, n, k, if (! (n % k), moebius(n/k), 0)); Tr = matrix(nn, nn, n, k, n--; k--; if ((n==k), 1, if (n==2*k+1, -1, 0))); Ti = Tr^(-1); Tp = Tm*Ti; for (n=1, nn, for (k=1, n, print1(Tp[n, k], ", ");); print(););} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Mar 28 2015
(PARI) T(n, k)={ if(n%k, 0, sumdiv(n/k, d, my(e=valuation(d, 2)); if(d==1<<e, moebius(n/(k*d)), 0))) } \\ _Andrew Howroyd_, Aug 03 2018
xref: Column 1 is A087003 (Moebius transform of A209229).
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, Apr 10 2007
